transgenic plants for the stress treatment analysis, since the EgFAD8 promoter is

mechanismthat the light regulates the expression of
sis is that more chloroplasts are needed for fatty acid synthesis in the dark than in the light,
since the rate of fatty acid synthesis in leaves is six-fold higher in the light than in the dark [
Thus, to maintain the constitutive function, more chloroplasts are synthesized in the leave
cells, and the expression level of genes encoding the corresponding enzymes involved in the
synthesis of chloroplast might be up-regulated. FAD8 is responsible for the polyunsaturated
]. However, the related mechanismneeds to be
In conclusion, we have isolated and identified a plastidial ω-3 fatty acid desaturase
function of EgFAD8 has been confirmed by heterolo-
gously expression in yeast, with showing the conversion of linoleic to linolenic acid. Moreover,
also revealed that it mainly involved in the synthesis of chlo-
roplast membrane, unlike ER-localized ω-3 fatty acids that is tightly correlated with the oil
gene could be induced by low temperature and darkness.
Overall, these results will be helpful for understanding the function and regulation of plastidial
ω-3 fatty acid desaturases in higher plants.
